source_comments: I read from where the webtoon left off and there isn’t much difference. There is very little you miss out on, like some dialogue, some small situations, descriptions, and some key insights. It would be better to read from the beginning, but personally I don’t have that kind of time to waste
Insane spelling of his name

It doesn’t take much away from the story, but some of the titles, such as grades of constellations, are inconsistent and confusing (especially when compared to the webtoon). I recommend reading the full webtoon and then moving on the to novel because then if there’s any inconsistencies, you have the context from the official translations in the webtoon to fill in the gaps. Other than that, there’s no problem with continuing to read the novel
Wonder Egg Priority

There definitely are grammar and sentence structure errors, but it’s the same anywhere you read it. It seems like whoever translated the entirety of ORV (not the creator of that site, because other sources like WebNovel look exactly the same), that translator didn’t get it proofread or edited. That’s just what I think
